title: We’ll never stop online trolls – so let’s go after real criminals instead
text:
There is a corner of my local park I take extreme lengths to avoid. Even when it’s pouring, I’ll take the long way around; the east, west or south entrance – anything to bypass the huddle of hostile strangers crouching among the pigeon splatter, idly spewing bile at passers-by.

They are also why I am not on Twitter. Or Facebook.

Because I have no desire to be cursed or threatened (albeit emptily) by people I don’t know, and because I don’t want to wake up to one of those strangers telling me he or she is going to murder my husband and rape me, along with every female member of my extended family, and, by the way, do I know that I look like an [insert farmyard animal of choice]?

I have chosen...
description: There is a corner of my local park I take extreme lengths to avoid.
